content: It doesn't work...also needs to always run in the background leading to battery loss.

I am in the homes of hundreds of people each day. I was in contact with at least 130 people who later tested positive. Apparently none of them had this app. Even if they had alerted positive, I would not had gone into quarantine or been tested because I have taken all of the necessary precautions and then some. I no longer see any reason to drain my battery for this app. It is past time to uninstall. 1,500,000 people in PBC. Less than 2,000 downloads = .001% using app. Useless
No support for the Android " Exposure Notification" feature?
App is awesome! So easy to use! Making the county safer!
Not installing. It won't send the one time code. I love the idea, this is what we need! But please it has to be simple for everyone to use.
replyContent: We have not received a complaint about this issue before. However, please send us the details at support@combatcovidapp.com , we will try to help you install the app.

content: Fantastic tool - great app. Kudo's to PBC for being so proactive

łBecause they are very important to me and I would feel bad if I got them sick. Hopefully the app actually works! as it says it does. Unfortunately these days most apps talk a big game and just dont deliver as they should work. Or they work great or they work great till you update the devices software and then are rendered useless.

The user interface needs help! I accidentally marked myself covid positive by clicking a tab, it have a warning that did not ask me if I was covid positive but instead asked if I wanted to upload my information. That is really unclear. I could find no way to undo this mistake. Reply to the response from the developer: At the time i reviewed it, the "3 step process" was definitely not a clearly defined clearly labeled 3 step process for marking yourself positive. Hopefully it has changed.
replyContent: To avoid false positive errors, it is a three step process. Always follow the instructions on the screen.

Needs to be publicized (and used) much more for it to be effective. Thanks.
Great idea, I read about the issue with positive, this needs to be improved. The app needs update and additional functionality for example ability to make testing appointment directly from app.
replyContent: Privacy and confidentiality are paramount to the app. While it would be a useful option, allowing you to set-up an appointment from the app, would violate that commitment to privacy.

content: Pretty good so far, the instructions were easy to follow and it working good, it even reminds me with a notification to keep it running!!! I live in Boca and everyone in my family and me go to Deerfield area a lot, does this work in Broward?

My husband downloaded combat covid a few days ago to try it out. He said that it was easy so I did it last night. I have had it running and no problems so far. I also like it has a lot of information for the people in palm beach to read about the disease. Thank you to the county for giving us this. I am going to show friends – well tell them I am not seeing anybody these days.

Why so these political extremist/anti-mask fanatics interject their lunatic opinions into EVERYTHING! I’ve had the app running for several days now and so do several friend and family. I love it. It is simple to use and seems to be running flawlessly. Good job.
Shifty beeps every 2 minutes an im alone in my home with no one around it got bugs
replyContent: The app has no ability to send beeps to anyone. It simply is not a function of the app to be able to do.

content: I accidentally marked my self positive and I am not don't know how to fix it. So I would say it needs some work so people don't have the same problem.
replyContent: It's a 3-step process to say that you are positive. As we don't have access to any user info or a centralized system, process is irreversible. However it is reset every 14 days.

content: is this app not compatible w/ Android Covid Exposure Notification service?
replyContent: The Apple/Google System requires that local/state governments generate an ID code for each positive test. Neither USA nor states have centralized health care systems that can do this. There is no way to efficiently match millions of test results with an ID code.  It’s a major downfall of their system’s use in USA vs. other countries.

content: Kudos to the county for making this available for use. Can’t tell yet what needs to be improved.  It was an easy and fast install but I did have to read it carefully to see what it was doing but it doesn’t look like other apps.  Not sure what I could say to fix that though.
Great idea for an app. Glad my sister shared with me. Not much I had to do hope it works
I am rooting for this app to be a huge success and help us here in PBC.  Hope everyone downloads it, uses it and we kick this viruses a**.

This app still needs help. Like others, I also accidentally marked myself positive. There needs to be a way to edit that. Plus it sent me a verification code, but didn't wait for me to enter it. It just accepted me.
replyContent:
It's a 3-step process to say that you are positive. As we don't have access to any user info or a centralized system, process is irreversible. However it is reset every 14 days. 
On some Android devices, when you receive the code, device automatically recognizes it and enters it to the app. That's why you thought it passed without entering a code.

content: Read the fine print of the user agreement VERY carefully! If you agree to it: you give up ALL of your rights. Advertised as not transmitting private information, yet it still has functionality to do so, and the agreement says they can whenever they want! Considering sensitivity of subject, potential for abuse, and waiving all rights in order to use this: one should avoid at all cost! Edit: read agreement and decide for yourself – you waive all your rights! Shield's reply is disingenuous at best.
replyContent: Absolutely False. Totally Untrue: CombatCOVID does not obtain ANY identifying information that could be sold to third parties. No personal information requested /obtained that anyone gives away any right to. You have changed your review 8 times with a different inaccurate statement each time. See: https://prnt.sc/tqqcuu and https://prnt.sc/tqqd4o

replyContent: Thank you for your suggestion, it's a good one. We're working on a couple of modifications that will be out shortly in the next update.
